Description: Girdle: composed of many disc beads of pink limestone and shell, one cylinder, a number of short and long barrels and a large truncated convex bicone, all of cornelian, and one long conical barrel shape of green glazed steatite. The beads are now strung in a single row; originally the beads formed a single girdle with six rows of beads.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Mostagedda, Grave 544 Found at the waist of a young woman
Curator's comments: Brunton tentatively identified the pink limestone beads as pinkish-grey sea-shell. Also from this burial: bangle (1929,1015.468), bracelet with amulet (1929,1015.469), girdles (1929,1015.471 & 1929,1015.472 & 1929,1015.473), necklaces (1929,1015.474 & 1929,1015.475). Bibliography: G. Brunton, ‘Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture’ (London, 1937), 101-2; Tomb register, pl.XLVIII; Bead register, pl.XLIXA.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (321)
